title: Easy Bot
reLoignTips: This session has expired. To log in to Easy Bot again, please click Login Again.
modelNameEmpty: Class Name can not be empty!

creation.taskNameDesc: Task Name can be between 3 and 20 characters long and contain only characters, numbers, and dashes but can't start or end with a dash. Should not be identical with existing project names.

tips.taskNameFormat: The task name format is incorrect, please check.
tips.epNotReady: Predict Endpoint is not ready, please retry.

tips.title: Image Detection
tips.line1: Image classification is the primary domain, in which deep neural networks play the most important role of medical
tips.line2: image analysis. The image classification accepts the given input images and produces output classification for identifying
tips.line3: whether the disease is present or not.

image.title: Image Classification
image.desc: With three steps, your input images are classfied. You can export ML models and use it in mobile devices or broswers.
image.noSamplesTips: First two classes need contains samples

step1.name: Step 1: Define Classes
step1.enterName: Enter the name of the class. Final result will be in one of the class
step1.s3BucketDesc: The Amazon S3 bucket that you want ML-Bot to store your access logs in.

step2.name: Step 2: Train Model
step2.time: The training process takes about 2 minutes

step3.name: Step 3: Preview and Export Result
step3.desc: The model training completed. You can preview the result
step3.chooseS3: Choose S3 bucket to export model
step3.ready: Enabled after predict service is ready.

step4.name: Step 4 (Optional): Setup this feature into your own Amazon Web Services Account Info
step4.desc: Click the button to deploy a cloudformation stack into your own Amazon Web Services account. You can upload images from S3 as input and output the result from your S3 bucket. All Amazon Web Services resources are already setup for you within the template.

step5.name: Step 5 (Optional): Make API Call Info
step5.desc: By calling the API of this feature, you can don’t need to setup your own Amazon Web Services resources, you can simply call the API from your code. Please see the pricing model for the detailed information.
step5.publicEndpoint: This is a public endpoint provided by Amazon Web Services Solutions.
step5.exploreMore: Explore more Similar APIs (provided by Amazon Web Services Partners

object.desc: With three steps, your input images are labled. You can export ML models and use it in mobile devices or broswers.

ner.desc: With three steps, you can use NER.

tips.confimStop: Are you sure you want to stop the Task
tips.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the Task
